text: e Let C be the fastest and C's be the slowest computers. These two are assigned two jobs. Now out of the remaining 4 jobs we need to ensure (), gets at least 1. Without this constraint we can assign 4 jobs to 3 computers in 3% = 81 ways. Out of these 81 ways 2¢ = 16 will be having no jobs for Cy. So, number of possible ways so that C', gets at least one job = 81 — 16 = 65.
